channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report X-2023120650
item.description:
Report X-2023120650

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: TUSCALOOSA
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was dropped when loaded to the truck and damage was not discovered until later in the afternoon. Area was secured, contents were loaded into a hazmat bin. DescribePack: Crack in bottom of the drum DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: once discovered contents were collected and loaded into drum until nothing remained on the truck or dock.

item.title: Report X-2023120709
item.description:
Report X-2023120709

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: DOTHAN
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package went out for delivery with the driver. Driver discovered the product beginning to leak from the lid and placed in a plastic back. Package was returned back to station. OutBound admin brought the package to QA to be processed. DescribePack: Paint leaking around the rim of the pail. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Driver placed into plastic bag while in truck. Once at station, pail was placed inside a hazmat line tote.

item.title: Report X-2023120722
item.description:
Report X-2023120722

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023120722 SequenceEvent: Package was put into a hazardous bin sideways which caused the jerrican inside to leak due to its faulty closure. DescribePack: loose top DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: package sat in a hazardous bin. 2. 2023120724 SequenceEvent: Package was found damaged on delivery van by driver. Driver claims the package was put on the van damaged when and noticed it before delivering. Package was isolated until coming back to the station. DescribePack: Liquid spilled from jerrican while inside the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated.

item.title: Report X-2023120817
item.description:
Report X-2023120817

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Admin spotted the package sitting top down next to an induction belt and alerted manager. Upon seeing the yellow leakage, area was covered in neutralizing agent to absorb the spill. Package appears to have fallen from to of belt and landed on the caps, causing the failure. No other damage was caused and location has been cleaned. DescribePack: Package appears to have landed on its caps, causing the failure. Spill covered an area of about 2 square meters. Caps were not loose, leading me to believe the impact cause the leakage. From what we were able to observe, there was no evident source of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Neutralizing absorbent agent was spread over spill, and package was placed in a containment bag and bin.

item.title: Report X-2023121119
item.description:
Report X-2023121119

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO PACKAGE WEARING PROPER PPE, DECISION TREE IN HAND. PACKAGE LEAKING PROFUSELY ON FLOOR OF TRAILER. USING APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER CONTAINED LEAKER AND TRANSPORTED TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
